prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.
original_avatar: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response.png
swipes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: Will I become step-mother to Stefan's daughter's?

Stefan should be represented by the 9th house (foreign connection), Stefan's 1st daughter by the Ascendant's 2nd house (Stefan's 5th), Stefan's 2nd daughter by the Ascendant's 4th house (Stefan's 7th), and Me by the Ascendant.

I've provided a cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a step‐by‐step list of the relevant horary chart data extracted solely from the provided chart and cross‑reference guide, organized by significators and key aspects:

1. Parties and House Assignments
 • Querent (Melissa Gale) is represented by the Ascendant: 7° Virgo.
 • Stefan is represented by the 9th house. The 9th house cusp is at 28° Aries and contains the Moon and Uranus. Its traditional ruler, Mars (ruler of Aries), is taken as Stefan’s chief significator.
 • Stefan’s first daughter is indicated by the Ascendant’s 2nd house (corresponding to Stefan’s 5th house). The 2nd house cusp begins at 1° Libra; its ruler is Venus.
 • Stefan’s second daughter is indicated by the Ascendant’s 4th house (corresponding to Stefan’s 7th house). The 4th house cusp begins at 3° Sagittarius; its ruler is Jupiter.

2. Key Planetary Placements (from the provided chart data)
 • Sun: 16°27′ Aquarius (in the 6th house)
 • Moon: 12°25′ Taurus (located in the 9th house with Uranus)
 • Mercury (Melissa’s Ascendant lord for Virgo): 13°11′ Aquarius (in the 6th house)
 • Venus (ruler representing the first daughter): 0°30′ Aries (assigned by the guide to a significance within the cross‑reference; note that house placement according to the provided house listing is with the 7th house group)
 • Mars (ruler of the 9th cusp for Stefan): 19°22′ Cancer (in the 11th house, retrograde)
 • Jupiter (ruler representing the second daughter): 11°16′ Gemini (in the 10th house)
 • Saturn: 17°51′ Pisces (in the 7th house)
 • Uranus: 23°16′ Taurus (listed among the objects in the 9th house)
 • Neptune: 28°05′ Pisces (in the 7th house)
 • Pluto: 2°10′ Aquarius (in the 5th house)
 • North Node: 29°38′ Pisces (in the 7th house)
 • Chiron: 19°37′ Aries (in the 8th house)

3. Major Aspects and Their Orb Details
 • Mars Square Chiron (orb: 0°)
 • Mars Trine Saturn (orb: 2°)
 • Mars Sextile Uranus (orb: 4°)
 • Moon Square Mercury (orb: 1°)
 • Sun Conjunct Mercury (orb: 3°)
 • Mercury Trine Jupiter (orb: 2°)
 • Venus Conjunct North Node (orb: 1°)
 • Neptune Conjunct North Node (orb: 1°)
 • Pluto Sextile IC (orb: 1°)
 • Pluto Trine MC (orb: 1°)
 • Pluto Sextile North Node (orb: 3°)
 • Venus Sextile MC (orb: 3°)
 • Sun Sextile Chiron (orb: 3°)
 • Venus Sextile Pluto (orb: 2°)
 • Venus Conjunct Neptune (orb: 2°)
 • North Node Sextile MC (orb: 4°)
 • Ascendant Square IC (orb: 4°)
 • Ascendant Square MC (orb: 4°)
 • Jupiter Square Ascendant (orb: 4°)
 • Sun Square Moon (orb: 4°)
 • North Node Trine IC (orb: 4°)
 • Neptune Sextile MC (orb: 5°)
 • Uranus Sextile Neptune (orb: 5°)
 • Moon Sextile Saturn (orb: 5°)
 • Neptune Trine IC (orb: 5°)
 • Moon Trine Ascendant (orb: 5°)
 • Sun Trine Jupiter (orb: 5°)
 • Saturn Sextile Uranus (orb: 6°)
 • Mercury Sextile Chiron (orb: 6°)
 • Jupiter Square Saturn (orb: 6°)
 • Sun Square Uranus (orb: 7°)
 • Jupiter Opposition IC (orb: 8°)
 • Jupiter Conjunct MC (orb: 8°)

4. Identified Patterns and Structures
 • A T‑Square is noted involving the MC (3° Gemini), the Ascendant (7° Virgo), and the IC (3° Sagittarius) with Jupiter (11° Gemini) as an active component.
 • A “Cradle” pattern appears, involving the MC, IC, Pluto (2° Aquarius), North Node (29° Pisces), and Venus (0° Aries), which may influence supportive or developmental energies around relational matters.

5. Summary of Relevance to the Query
 • Melissa’s significator (Ascendant and its lord Mercury) and Stefan’s significator (the 9th house, its planetary contents, plus Mars as its ruler) are both clearly defined.
 • The daughters’ significators are linked to Venus (first daughter) and Jupiter (second daughter).
 • Aspects (especially the Moon–Mercury square and Mars’s aspects) will be central when assessing connections between Melissa’s condition, Stefan’s configuration, and potential offspring from the new union.
 • The T‑Square and Cradle pattern indicate complex dynamics which will later be evaluated for how they influence the likelihood of Melissa becoming step‑mother.

The above constitutes the compiled chart data relevant to the horary query using established horary principles.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Drawing upon the horary chart data and following traditional horary principles, I offer the following interpretation regarding whether you will become step-mother to Stefan’s daughter:

1. Significators and House Assignments
 • Your significator—represented by the Ascendant in Virgo and its lord Mercury (located in Aquarius in the 6th house)—carries the weight of your personal initiative and readiness for new relational responsibilities.
 • Stefan’s role is indicated by the ninth house. The presence of the Moon and Uranus in this house, together with Mars as its ruling planet in Cancer (11th house), conveys an element of unexpected change and emotional turbulence concerning his connections.
 • The first daughter’s significator is Venus (linked to the Ascendant’s 2nd house, paralleling his 5th house), symbolizing the softer, nurturing aspects of youth.
 • The second daughter’s significator is Jupiter (linked to the Ascendant’s 4th house, paralleling his 7th house), which speaks to expansion in family matters, yet also to matters of legacy and social order.

2. Key Aspects and Their Implications
 • The Moon’s square to Mercury (orb: 1°) sets up a tension between your personal desires and the emotional, unanticipated influences emerging from Stefan’s domain. This confrontation suggests that while there is an openness for a union that brings family integration, there will be underlying emotional disturbances or miscommunications to navigate.
 • Mars—the ruler of Stefan’s house—forms a square with Chiron at an exact orb. This strongly indicates potential hurt or a sense of wounding around his family matters. Such a configuration may mark difficulties in adjustments or past wounds that might impede a seamless transition into a step-mother role.
 • Benefic aspects such as Mars’s trine with Saturn and sextile with Uranus indicate that, despite challenges, there exists supportive energy that can help manage disruptive changes. Saturn’s involvement often marks a slow-building structure in relationships that eventually solidifies, while Uranus’ influence hints that unexpected opportunities for integration may emerge.
 • The “Cradle” pattern, involving Venus, Pluto, and the North Node, suggests that there exists a formative, almost destined nurturing relationship in the making. This pattern speaks both to supportive evolutionary growth and to the possibility of family bonds that evolve through transformative processes.
 • The T‑Square configuration, connecting the Ascendant, IC, and MC, underscores a persistent tension that requires rebalancing between your personal autonomy, the foundational home environment, and your public or relational commitments. It reflects a need to reconcile your individual identity with a new role that may transform your domestic life.

3. Synthesis of the Chart’s Indications
 • Your personal significator is active and engaged but faces challenges from the emotional and unpredictable nature of Stefan’s chart house. Tensions, as seen in the Moon–Mercury square and Mars–Chiron aspect, signal that the pathway to forming a step-maternal relationship may involve periods of emotional discomfort or unresolved issues.
 • The supportive “Cradle” aspect pattern and benefic configurations (Mars trine Saturn, Mars sextile Uranus) point toward the potential for eventual stability, provided that both parties work through the initial disruptions.
 • The daughters’ signifiers, represented by Venus and Jupiter, underscore that the incoming familial ties will carry both emotional warmth and a measure of external expectation. Their placements and aspects suggest that while nurturing roles are possible, the integration of these roles will require adjustments and could evolve over time rather than happening abruptly.

Based on the chart, the indication is that there is genuine potential for you to become step-mother, yet this prospect is contingent on navigating interpersonal tensions and emotional hurdles. The process may not be smooth, as signified by aspects that suggest initial discord; however, if the transformative energies indicated in the chart are embraced, a stable new family dynamic could eventually form.

Proceed with mindfulness toward these challenging aspects, as the chart advises diligent work in healing past wounds and creating a supportive framework for these emerging family connections.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: The T-square,  that alludes to rebalancing of my personal autonomy, foundational home environment, and public and relational commitments. Could this be pointing towards my impending divorce and active pursuit towards purchase of a home?  These are two major aspects in my current life that are imminent. They are in active process right now. The divorce is set for the final hearing on February the 14th (10 days from now), and I already have pre-approval letters from several financial institutions towards purchasing a house. So my house will be purchased within the next 45 days before they expire.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Your T-square configuration—uniting the Ascendant (your personal identity), the IC (home/foundational environment), and the MC (public/relational commitments)—strongly mirrors the transformative upheavals you're currently experiencing. The tension inherent in this pattern indicates an urgent need to rebalance your inner self with the external circumstances, often manifesting as significant shifts in your domestic and relational spheres.

In practical terms, the T-square can indeed point toward the dissolution of an existing partnership and the creation of a new home base. In your case, the impending final hearing for the divorce and the active pursuit of a new house align well with this pattern. The reconfiguration of your home environment (IC) and your shift in relational commitments (MC) is being driven by a pressing need to assert your autonomy (Ascendant), a dynamic that the T-square so clearly symbolizes.

Given the precise timing and the supportive indicators in your current transit chart—especially as they relate to new beginnings and reordering of your domestic affairs—the energy you’re experiencing is a natural, albeit challenging, part of your ongoing transformation. The chart does not just suggest upheaval; it guides you to recognize that these changes are the catalyst for re-establishing balance in your life.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: So, being that that particular formation for me is in process for resolution, does that lean even more in favor of this outcome to expand my family?

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes: Analyzing the T-square further, its resolution does favor a more expansive reordering of your domestic life. The tension between your personal drive (Ascendant), foundational home (IC), and your external commitments (MC) signals transformation. In your current setting, the pending divorce and imminent home purchase are clear markers of this rebalancing. The chart's energies suggest that as the old structures dissolve, the emerging configuration carries the potential to integrate new familial bonds, consistent with an expansion of your family. While the indicators point toward a favorable outcome in forming these new domestic and relational ties, the process will entail working through the interpersonal and emotional challenges inherent in the T-square.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Please forgive me, madam, but I'm struggling to understand what you're trying to say. Can you be more clear?

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Madame Esmeralda Blackwood: adjusts her shawl and leans forward, speaking with clear, direct conviction

Yes, my dear. Let me be perfectly clear - the resolution of your current major life changes (the divorce and new home purchase) creates a more favorable environment for becoming stepmother to Stefan's daughters. As these immediate pressures resolve themselves, you'll have both the emotional and physical space needed to welcome this new family dynamic.

The T-square in your chart isn't just showing the tension of your current transitions - it's showing that once these changes complete (divorce finalized, new home secured), the stage is properly set for this family expansion you're asking about.

Does this help clarify my meaning, dear one?
